question: The sum of money that yields a compound interest on 420 Rs. during the second year at 5% per annum is :
explanation:
$latex CI = P\\left [ \\left ( 1+\\frac{R}{100} \\right )^{T}-1 \\right ] - \\frac{PR}{100}&s=1$
$latex => 420 = P \\left [ \\left ( 1+\\frac{5}{100} \\right )^{2}-1 \\right ] - \\frac{P\\times 5}{100}&s=1$
$latex => 420 = P \\left [ \\left ( \\frac{21}{20} \\right )^{2}-1 \\right ]-\\frac{5P}{100}&s=1$
$latex => 420 = \\frac{41P}{400}-\\frac{5P}{100} = \\frac{21P}{400}&s=1$
$latex => P = \\frac{420\\times 400}{21} = 8000\\ Rs.&s=1$
Hence option [D] is correct answer.
